CHAT.comment: letter one - Dear Danikka , How are you? Do you like having Tanya out in school withy ou? Are you coming home in the summer? Write soon. Love , Chi; letter two - Dear Dominic How are you? I finally wrote to you , arent' you glad? I miss you. Love Chi

in the first letter to her sister , FAT tells Chi who to write to and suggests the content of the letter. (Chi's attitude is , why write if we know everything about each other); once Fat has suggested the general content , Chi writes the text by herself , silently; They discuss punctuation marks a little but most of the talk is disputes over information/content rather than the writing process; Chi seems reluctant to write first letter , but insists on writing a second one to her brother. Chi decides who and what to write in this letter; Chi asks how to spell finally; Fat says , how do you think , then corrects her as she goes; Punctuation is a problem again.

u.a: gives Chi book to hold under tablet
turns piece of paper over and points
Chi is getting a new sheet of paper in the tablet but instead of tearing it off , MOT flips pages back
finishing the y in finally and going on to the w in the next word wrote
talks with someone in the background
crosses out extra t on aren't
takes pen and points with it
there is a lenghty discussion about xeroxing the letter and getting it back to Chi
